title: Determine a derivative graph from a function

content.question: The function <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGMbaaaa@39E6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is differentiable and increasing for all real numbers <math> <semantics> <mi>x</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4baaaa@39F8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the graph of <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGMbaaaa@39E6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> has exactly one point of inflection. Of the following, which could be the graph of <math> <semantics> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>â€²</mo> </msup> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGMbGbauaaaaa@39F2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, the derivative of <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGMbaaaa@39E6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> ?

choices.label: Each option shows a graph in an x y plane. For each graph the horizontal axis is labeled x, the vertical axis is labeled y, and the origin is labeled O.    From left to right, the graph starts in quadrant 2, bends downward as it moves down into quadrant 1, has a sharp corner, and then bends downward as it moves up.
From left to right, the graph starts in quadrant 2, bends upward as it moves down through the origin and into quadrant 4, and then bends upward as it moves up into quadrant 1.
From left to right, the graph starts in quadrant 3, bends downward as it moves up through quadrant 2 and into quadrant 1, and then bends upward as it moves up.
From left to right, the graph is a line that starts in quadrant 3, moves up through quadrant 4 and into quadrant 1.

From left to right, the graph starts in quadrant 2, bends upward as it moves up, crosses the y-axis into quadrant 1, bends downward as it moves up and then down, bends upward as it moves down and then up, and bends downward as it moves up.

content.answer: Each option shows a graph in an x y plane. For each graph the horizontal axis is labeled x, the vertical axis is labeled y, and the origin is labeled O.    From left to right, the graph starts in quadrant 2, bends downward as it moves down into quadrant 1, has a sharp corner, and then bends downward as it moves up.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
